action.action-desc: Mr. Schneider (for himself, Mr. Arrington, Ms. Sewell, and Mrs. Steel) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exemption from gross income for mandatory restitution or civil damages as recompense for trafficking in persons.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Human Trafficking Survivor Tax Relief Act.

section.header: Exempting from Federal income taxation restitution and civil damages awarded under sections 1593 and 1595 of title 18, United States Code

subsection.text: Part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting before section 140 the following new section:

section.header: Certain amount received as restitution or civil damages as recompense for trafficking in persons
section.text: Gross income shall not include any civil damages, restitution, or other monetary award (including compensatory or statutory damages and restitution imposed in a criminal matter) awardedâ€”

paragraph.text: pursuant to an order of restitution under section 1593 of title 18, United States Code, or
in an action under section 1595 of title 18, United States Code.

subsection.text: The table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting before the item relating to section 140 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 139J. Certain amount received as restitution or civil damages as recompense for trafficking in persons.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
